intro: Mentha aquatica var. incisoserrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water mint, is a perennial herb native to moist environments in Europe and Asia. It features slender, aromatic leaves with a serrated margin, which is characteristic of its varietal name. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers arranged in whorls along the stem, typical of the Lamiaceae family. It thrives in wet soils near streams, marshes, and along waterways. Its essential oils contain menthol and other compounds, making it valuable in herbal medicine and aromatherapy.
